isis.stitle: TSI 05-08-06RA - Full Power Brake Electrical Connector Service

subjectgroup.subject: Full Power Brake Electrical Connector Service

geninfo.title: Revision Description:
geninfo.para: Secondary locking device and part number added.

There are four (4) electrical connectors in the full power brake circuit that if the connector is not properly engaged and locked or all seals are not in position may allow moisture to penetrate leading to corrosion and possible logging of intermittent fault codes in the ECU

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.

step1.para: Locate the connectors identified in Figure 1 and Figure 2.
Disconnect the connector and inspect for corrosion. Replace any corroded terminals.

note.para: Refer to Service Section S08291, Chapter 10, Pages 35 through 40 for detailed information on connectors.

step1.para: Inspect the connector seals to make sure the seals are in place.

note.para: Applying excessive dielectric grease will cause dislodging of the seal during reassembly of the connector.

step1.para: Lightly coat the connector seal and terminals with dielectric grease Part Number 1831731C1.
For 16 pin connectors only, install secondary locking device into the connector as shown in Figure 3. Make sure it locks in place.
Repeat for the remaining connectors identified in Figure 1 and Figure 2.

step1.para: After reassembly, make sure that each connector is fully mated and no seals are pushed out of position.
Clear fault codes and check for proper operation.
